content.question: The parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals t squared plus t plus 1"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 10"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. Which of the following is the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> ?

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from 0 to 120 in increments of 10. The y axis ranges from negative 20 to 20 in increments of 10. All coordinates are approximate.

The curve has the general shape of a parabola that opens right.

The bottom right of the curve begins at (91 comma negative 10).

The curve increases from right to left, passing through (21 comma negative 5) and reaching its vertex at (0.85 comma negative 0.5).

The curve changes directions, increasing from left to right.

The curve passes through (31 comma 5) and ends at (111 comma 10).

The x axis ranges from 0 to 120 in increments of 10. The y axis ranges from negative 20 to 20 in increments of 10. All coordinates are approximate.

The curve has the general shape of the upper portion of a parabola that opens right.

The curve begins at (1 comma 0) and increases from left to right.

The curve passes through (31 comma 5) and ends at (111 comma 10).

The x axis ranges from 0 to 120 in increments of 10. The y axis ranges from negative 20 to 20 in increments of 10. All coordinates are approximate.

The curve has the general shape of the upper portion of a parabola that opens right.

The curve begins at (1 comma 0) and increases from left to right.

The curve passes through (31 comma 10) and ends at (111 comma 20).

The x axis ranges from 0 to 120 in increments of 10. The y axis ranges from negative 20 to 20 in increments of 10. All coordinates are approximate.

The curve has the general shape of a parabola that opens right.

The bottom right of the curve begins at (91 comma negative 20).

The curve increases from right to left, passing through (21 comma negative 10) and reaching its vertex at (0.75 comma negative 1).

The curve changes directions, increasing from left to right.

The curve passes through (31 comma 10) and ends at (111 comma 20).

content.answer:
The x axis ranges from 0 to 120 in increments of 10. The y axis ranges from negative 20 to 20 in increments of 10. All coordinates are approximate.

The curve has the general shape of the upper portion of a parabola that opens right.

The curve begins at (1 comma 0) and increases from left to right.

The curve passes through (31 comma 10) and ends at (111 comma 20).

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
